domain: NDIS Provider: Fraudulent Invoicing Pattern Detected
label: SYSTEM FLAG
summary: Automated cross-referencing confirms provider billing exceeded maximum allowable hours per participant by 314% across multiple core supports.
why: Timesheet overlapping identified across 3 separate geographic zones simultaneously.
Historical AAT filings indicate previous directorship bans for identical directors.
Sub-contractor margins mathematically impossible without wage theft or ghost invoicing.
nextCheapestTest: Subpoena participant transport logs against claimed SIL hours.
killRule: If provider can prove systemic API failure on NDIS portal submission, downgrade to warning.

domain: BHP Group: WA Iron Ore Divestment Signal
label: TITAN RECORD
summary: Assessing probability of structural spin-off of legacy WA iron ore assets amidst rising ESG capital pressure and yield curve inversion.
why: Executive compensation metrics shifted from volume targets to margin/ESG scoring in Q4 filings.
Satellite imagery indicates 14% reduction in exploratory drilling capex outside core brownfield sites.
Subtle regulatory capture signals in Canberra pointing toward increased heritage site compliance costs.
nextCheapestTest: Monitor next dividend announcement; if payout ratio drops below 60% without new M&A, capital hoarding is confirmed.
killRule: If iron ore spot stays >$115/t for 90 days, cash flow prevents immediate restructuring pressure. Abort prediction.

label: TITAN RECORD
summary: Analyzing the inevitable decoupling of InfraCo from the retail arm to unlock dark fiber valuation premiums.
why: Internal transfer pricing between Retail and InfraCo was explicitly hardened in the latest half-year annexure.
Recent C-suite hires at InfraCo possess aggressive M&A and structural unbundling backgrounds.
NBN policy paralysis forces private infrastructure owners to aggressively monetize legacy copper/fiber conduits.
nextCheapestTest: Track sovereign wealth fund (Future Fund/AusSuper) shadow-bidding on European telecom infrastructure as a proxy.
killRule: If ACCC signals intention to regulate dark fiber pricing, valuation premium collapses. Hold.

domain: Macquarie Group: Green Energy Asset Rotation
label: TITAN RECORD
summary: Detecting early rotation out of mature European offshore wind into high-risk/high-yield Australian REZ storage.
why: Macquarie Asset Management quietly exited two mid-tier European wind consortia within the last 60 days.
AEMO constraint reports show escalating curtailment risks, making dispatchable storage the only viable alpha generator.
Lobbying footprint in NSW Parliament shifted entirely from transmission to battery firming capacity.
nextCheapestTest: Await next capacity auction; if Macquarie bids negative pricing to secure dispatch rights, rotation is confirmed.
killRule: If grid transmission upgrades are delayed beyond 2027, the storage arbitrage window closes. Unwind immediately.

label: TITAN RECORD
summary: Evaluating margin compression in core blood plasma therapies against the rise of synthetic FcRn inhibitors.
why: Competitor argenx's Vyvgart is rapidly cannibalizing the lucrative CIDP indication from traditional Ig therapies.
Collection volumes have normalized post-COVID, but donor compensation costs remain structurally elevated.
R&D capital allocation has quietly pivoted heavily toward gene therapy (Hemgenix) to offset immunoglobulin decay.
nextCheapestTest: Monitor Q3 US Medicare reimbursement narratives regarding synthetic vs traditional plasma treatments.
killRule: If FDA restricts label expansion for synthetic inhibitors due to infection risks, CSL regains moat.

label: TITAN RECORD
summary: Assessing tail-risk of fixed-rate mortgage roll-offs transitioning directly into non-performing loans.
why: Provisions for bad debts were subtly increased by 14% in the institutional banking division, not retail.
Direct observations of CBA aggressively discounting commercial property valuations to force early developer refinancing.
Deposit war peak has passed; net interest margin (NIM) compression is shifting from liability cost to asset quality.
nextCheapestTest: No test required. Institutional contagion is already priced into the Tier 1 capital buffers.
killRule: If the RBA cuts the cash rate by >50bps before Q4, the default wave is structurally deferred.
